title: CCTV of girl, 3, 'abducted' from friend's birthday party minutes before disappearance

Police have released surveillance footage which shows missing three-year-old Kamille McKinney in the minutes before her disappearance.

The toddler was last seen more than a week ago as she celebrated a friend's birthday in Alabama.

She was playing outside when, according to an 11-year-old witness, she was snatched by a black male and white female in a dark SUV.

Kamille was last seen wearing a pink t-shirt with a Minnie Mouse leopard print design.

Police hope this new video, which shows her in the front garden, will provide crucial new leads.

It shows two men outside the house where she was allegedly abducted.

(Image: FBI)

(Image: Birmingham Police)

The video ends just after the two children follow the second man out of view.

The force tweeted: "The video was recovered from a surveillance camera within the Tom Brown Housing complex at about the same time as Kamille McKinney was reported missing. If you are one of the people in the video, we need your help with the investigation! Please call at 205-254-7777."

Her traumatised parents have pleaded with the alleged kidnappers to release the girl and end their pain.

"Drop her off anywhere and let her out. Somebody will see her. Everybody knows what's going on," her father Dominic McKinney told CNN .

"That will be the end of that. We just want the baby back."

Birmingham Police Chief Patrick Smith says they have increased the reward for information that helps police solve the case to $20,000.

"You could literally call with your tip today, pick up your money in cash next week and you're totally anonymous," said Frank Barefield, chairman of Crime Stoppers of Metro Alabama.

(Image: FBI)

"There's no better deal in town than that."

The child's parents were given false hope on Wednesday after rumours surfaced that she had been found.

Heartbreakingly, they proved to be incorrect and the search continues.
description: Toddler Kamille McKinney has been missing for more than seven days after it is claimed she was snatched while playing outside during a birthday party
